import { colored, getLogger } from 'colorful-log-message';

// instantiate
// getLogger take 2 arguments
// 1. the colored instance
// 2. the color scheme (optional) default is "bullet-train"
const colorfulLogger = getLogger(colored)

console.log(
  colorfullLogger({
    level: "debug", // level
    message: {
      title: "Hello",
    },
    subtitle: "World",
  }),
);

Result

Success message

console.log(
  colorfulLogger({
    level: "success", // level
    message: {
      title: "Hello",
    },
    subtitle: "World",
  }),
);

Result: Level Success

console.log(
  colorfulLogger({
    level: "warn", // level
    message: {
      title: "Something went wrong",
    },
    subtitle: "HTTP Error [400]",
  }),
);

Result: Level Success

// passing theme minimal
const colorfulLogger = getLogger(colored, "minimal")

console.log(
  colorfulLogger({
    level: "warn", // level
    message: {
      title: "Something went wrong",
    },
    subtitle: "HTTP Error [400]",
  }),
);

Result: Minimal style Level Error

Full screen width and center alignment

// passing theme minimal
const colorfulLogger = getLogger(colored, "minimal")

console.log(
  colorfulLogger({
    level: "info", // level
    message: {
      title: "Hello",
    },
    subtitle: "World",
  }),
);

Result: Minimal style Level Info
